lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods is chipping and putting, and says he hopes to play in the Memorial in two weeks. But even if he cannot compete until the United States Open, he does not expect the same result as his last layoff during a season. Two years ago, Woods did not play for nine weeks after the death of his father. He returned to competition in the United States Open at Winged Foot and missed the cut for the only time in a major. “That was a totally different mental situation than I am now,” said Woods, who had surgery on his left knee April 15 to clean out some cartilage.
